content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Administrator is required to use specific programs to provide support for entrepreneurs, excluding services for small businesses owned by Indian tribes. Additionally, an annual report must be submitted to the Committee on Small Business. The Administrator must report annually to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program details, operating procedures, grant award processes, and a list of awardees, contractors, and vendors. The Administrator must report annually to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program details, operating procedures, grant award processes, awardees, contractors, vendors, funding amounts, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION.

Amends the Small Business Act to include governing data collection activities for grant applicants and requires the Administrator to report annually on data collection related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS.

Amends the Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships with the Administration.

SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS.

Amends the Small Business Act to remove certain items related to equity for SBDCs.

SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS.

Amends the Small Business Act to remove certain items related to equity for SBDCs.

SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS.

Limits the award of grants to SBDCs to entities that received grants prior to September 30, 2014. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses for disaster recovery without geographic limitations. Small business development centers can provide assistance to small businesses located outside the state affected by a declared disaster, ensuring continuity of services in any state. Small business development centers must ensure continuity of services in any state where they provide counselors, and personnel should have access to disaster recovery facilities designated by the Administrator. The Administrator shall allow small business development center personnel to use designated facilities for disaster recovery assistance. SEC. 10. Includes entrepreneurship training for unemployed individuals by amending the Small Business Act to educate and assist unemployed individuals in starting new businesses.
